comments: When Eclipse is launched and the Java perspective was selected when Eclipse was last closed exceptions are thrown. This does not occur if other perspectives (such as Plug-in Development) are restored on launch. It is also no problem to switch to the Java perspective later on. See attachment for error log.
This seems to be related to the Active Hierarchy view which was only visible on the Java perspective.
Thanks Steffen, I can reproduce this race condition by having the Active Hierarchy visible.

The exceptions are gone when using cvs head.

I noticed another glitch though when using Active Hierachy and Active Search on the perspective that is restored on launch. I put both views in the same tabbed pane and active Active Hierarchy. When I then launch Eclipse and select Active Search the view displays the following exception:

All these problems should be solved now.

In the refactoring I created an additional layer "resources" layer between context.ui and mylar.java, and introduced a race condition in the initialization.  A new dev build will be available shortly--please reopen if you see any problems with the latest.
